alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN TAOS COUNTY THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Talpa, or 8 miles south of Taos, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taos, Shady Brook, Taos Pueblo, Ranchos De Taos, Pilar, Talpa, Los Cordovas and El Prado. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 250 and 262. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 59 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Persons in campgrounds should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley
